6N6S7Ze_TIOhHjGq0qBMUg.text: I always enjoy stopping in here on my Edinburgh layovers. The food is excellent, they have live music every night after 10pm and the bar tenders are super knowledgable about Whisky!  I enjoy Whisky, but am by no means an expert. I always ask for recommendations and am never disappointed. The bar tenders will help you select a Whisky that suits your taste and will tell you the story behind it.   Definitely recommend this place for someone who wants to explore Whisky and get some good Scottish food to soak it up.

OYgNIC7J8k3afxnr_885yA.text: This pub was great! The service was a bit slow because there was a lot of people, but the food was amazing.  They had a great selection of beer and wine, along with some specialty cocktails.  I ordered the steak and ale pie which was lovely.  The steak was incredibly tender and the topping was flaky and light.  My friend ordered the Whiski burger, which I tasted, and also fell in love with.  You get hearty portions, good quality food, and great music to listen to.  For dessert we ordered some of their award winning ice cream which was delicious and also light.  I recommend coming here, as they also do have a great selection of whiskey! If you are very hungry do not go on the weekend as it gets very packed and the service is a bit slow.

p6ZRexHXuxPJliD4BS2bnQ.text: Went for dinner on New Year's Eve, our smily, pint-sized waitress was lovely and attentive and friendly; when she realised we'd been waiting quite a while for our food, she apologised profusely and gave us a discount off our bill .  Haggis tower - yum! The service at the sister restaurant on Bank St was also great.

UBaHI5n3UluPnxmpOw0VpQ.text: Great food and great service. We were thoroughly pleased with our dinner at Whiski's. Staff was very nice and knowledgeable as well. Atmosphere was a bit cluttered for my liking but a seat at the window was a nice break from the chaos.

pj5Mtvfcg1IlpTW0LzqcJw.text: Stopped by to grab dinner after the candle lighting for hogmanay. All of the other places we passed were packed and only had reserved seats.  This is a pretty cute scottish pub with plenty of whiskey and beer choices. We ordered the mackerel pate, whiski burger, haggis tower, seabass, and rump. The rumo and haggis tower were delicious. The burger and seabass were only okay.

9wwlULUl01e96mELEqqDMQ.text: Attempted to pop in for a drink, but the bartender refused to accept my wife's U.S. issued ID even tho she was clearly of age and stated that they would only accept a passport, which was at the hotel (who goes out on a Friday night with their passport?). First time we had this issue in Edinburgh and promptly went to another pub down the street, which didn't have any issues accepting her ID.

qk1-D6r-MIn6BULFL2xCqw.text: Nice casual dinner spot. Had the Scottish grilled salmon with mash and green beans. Enjoyed our dinner here, would recommend to anyone looking for a good spot in Edinburgh!

EZlwUuUhFIrvrGmBdgMujA.text: We had a terrible experience here. My friends and I are all 25 but we were denied drink here because we were not carrying our passports. We had three other forms of ID including our Irish issued ID cards and we were still VERY rudely turned away! If you're not from the UK make sure you bring your passport! This was clearly ridiculous and on top of that the woman helping us could not have been more rude!

slLCORgPkaPm4JKylJZqQQ.text: Whiki is a bar on the Royal Mile in Edinburgh.    The first time I went the bar tender recommended a really good beer, so A+ for the drinks. I also had the food here, which I think was a little ordinary but still decent for the price.   So recommended for a drink or a drink with food. Perhaps not ideal if you're just after food.

imJOceLfk8quVXUDd6BSow.text: A step up from typical bar food, with a corresponding small increase in the prices. Eccentric decorating and a varied beer menu. Of course, the scotch whiskey selection is extensive!

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

1Uzy-lHOrD1B8I5u00QspQ.text: Tourist bar on Royal Mile with good food, good beer and good whisky. Oh, and good music too (which is more than can  be said for most places on the Royal Mile)! They changed all the bar staff which is a shame but still okay for this part of town.

QCPGa1dERLPd0xGkC1FSEA.text: My last breakfast in Edinburgh before hopping on the plane back to Dublin. Was extremely happy I came in! The people were nice, and the food was outstanding. I had the full breakfast and for the price I thought it was loaded with food. All of it was very good too, not bland or a cheap tourist imitation. I really liked this place and was disappointed I hadn't gone in earlier.  Also, I can imagine that it's a pretty cool place in the evenings. They have live music every night and a ton of Scotch Whisky to try if you're into that sort of thing. Very cool place.

WU1E2txR4wncdugtIG4JDA.text: We had a fabulous experience here! Specifically with a bartender named Jamie. He helped me find my new favorite which I promptly went out and bought. A new start! It's got great atmosphere, the bathrooms are clean, and the people are very friendly. I can't comment on the food because we only stopped in for drinks, but it looked good. Highly recommended

AVGH9UrO_34mjxqaNm-RCg.text: Whiski is the kind of bar that will win the tourists over, while the locals will tend to head somewhere off the beaten track.  Serving up a mixture of pub grub and traditional Scots dishes (like cullen skink), Whiski blends contemporary decor with a traditional feel.  As the previous reviewers have said, it is quite a synthesized representation of the Scots pub, and it feels as though its existence is based on what tourists it can lure in. Nevertheless, I can imagine it would be quite charming to people travelling through Edinburgh, so it gets four stars from me since I can see its appeal to international guests. And when all is said and done, there's a good selection of booze behind the bar and well cooked food, so it's pleasant and popular with passer's by!

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

aPDwg__1lNbgbq4Fut1QtA.text: Great pub to stop in and sample lots and lots of different scotches. My husband and I were here just for drinks and a little snack. They have scotch flights available, which is a nice touch if you want to sample a variety. Not being a scotch drinker myself, I had a wonderful few glasses of the Thistle Cross apple cider which they have on tap and it's wonderful. Much much much better than the sickly sweet Bulmers everywhere else. My husband had a great time talking to the bartenders to identify really peaty scotches to drink, and they were very helpful in pointing him to new things to try. We had chips with cheese as a snack - they were standard good but a rather small serving size.

vYjXpQGKGXOJXASzDtCuwQ.text: Stopped in for lunch with my teenage daugther.  I was told I had to try "CULLEN SKINK", which was good.  And got a flight of Whiskey's.  The waitress was nice enough to explain each of them for me.  I'd go again.

MIwEFJIfrqf6QvQBhCUoCg.text: Bunch of idiots. Asking if I called here o elsewhere. Are you suggesting that the number in the yelp is wrong. Called before coming that I am with a five year old ... The man on the bar behaves as if only he knows the English language ... Won't allow us to wait in the bar won't take reservation than what was the point of calling and being told that I can come with my five year old and wait ... Disappointing ...

UfkaJogAlM9h18BpKrG00Q.text: We were looking for a nice place for some late night food and perhaps, some entertainment and we read good reviews of this place. We found the food pretty good and the dessert was excellent! They have some kind of performance every night of the week and ours was Traditionally folk songs. The performers gave such a rousing performance that some of the guests joined them in the clapping and singing! Very good experience indeed.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scotch Broth
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis Stack with Veges on the side
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bangers &amp; Mash

Bth4Qhf3b62gX-VynIROoQ.text: Amazing place to eat with one of the best whiskey selections in Edinburg. The service was great, the people friendly and the food was delicious. We got a flight of whiskey and had to stop ourselves from getting a second. I got the whiskey burger and it was delicious. Scottish cows are yummy!  This was our first stop in Scotland and it didn't disappoint.

9honK7vEHOOTWnS-5Czrgw.text: Excellent bartenders.  Theo was great in introducing us to some new single malts.  They have a large selection.  Food was solid Scottish fare with great, attentive service.

Ju1cyDnfg-ZofhVzXqClRA.text: Really beautiful restaurant along one of the main streets of Edinburgh. This area of town has a lot of places to eat, and this one is definitely worth going to! The venison is perfect while the fish and chips and the Caesar salad are great. Recommend for a slightly nicer meal in Edinburgh!

m3y569b49qnhyHFpWNKQ9A.text: This place... everything is good.    1. Cullen Skink SO good... I don't know how to put it.  We wanted six bowls of this.  2. Rump Steak perfectly cooked, great whiskey sauce.  3. Haggis Tower so good, fresh, delicious.  4. Sticky Toffee Pudding yes this is good too!!! WITH ice cream!!  Service is good too.  But the food... the best.

7qf_HQdacUD_KX4vHrWI4w.text: Tourist trap, food was Luke-warm, to cold, staff were friendly but way overpriced and more of a place to escape the cold and grab a drink walking back to the hotel... Muy expensivo everyone and the food was meh, be forewarned!

W1bcadNaul1UPkk4aQUMXA.text: Very rude staff. Wouldn't recommend to anyone. I was laughed at when I asked for a table. Went to Makars next door and was treated with respect

TSiv14TsUCSewISTtNWFiQ.text: What a fab pub with lots of atmosphere, fab food and all the whiski u could want.  In the evenings from 9.30 onwards they have music so this place has it all.  The decor is traditional with stag heads, photo's and Scottish memorabilia but with a bit of kitch like fairy lights.  Tables of 10 and more can make a booking otherwise just turn up have a drink or two and wait for a table to become available.   I had the haggis tower with a whiskey sauce tatties and neeps, gorgeous and very filling.  The house made chorizo and pork sausages,mash and onion gravy, banging.  The whiskey cheese cake and cranachan should not be missed.  Without shadow of a doubt I would recommend this place, miss this miss out. Xoxo

jjhkzM4OLZ6-ke6wPhlfwA.text: Great beer and whiski selection! Didn't have any food just came in for a few pints and some music. Bar staff were awesome! Super friendly in a real way. A good spot in the middle of the tourist world where locals come as well!

_wmvJDI_DtHq-Oi5jUYODA.text: Delicious first-time haggis experience, and really good steak pie. My daughter devoured her burger as well, and my son finished all his soup. Family-friendly and fun whisky flights.

PcpWZtxcdhLdbXxtn8j6gw.text: My first venture in here, I wasn't sure what to think.  It felt difficult to get attention for service.  But then it warmed up.  The staff turned out to be very friendly and helpful.  The whisky list is monstrous and the food is pretty good.  I ended up coming back a few times during my visit and standing around the bar and listening to music was a most enjoyable way to kill a few hours (and brain cells).    When someone says "Whiski", there's Whiski Bar and Restaurant and then their sister establishment, Whiski rooms.  While related, don't confuse the two.

40_EtyZ87rBhZVjFv9-IUA.text: This spot was recommended by 3 different people on Yelp and on the streets of EDI so I made it a must try. The recommendations definitely came thru on this place, it is awesome.  I had the steak and ale pie which is a modern deconstructed version. The flavors are so rich and creamy and the best thing about getting it their way is the pie crust is super flaky.   The mussels are great too. They come thru with a huge amount of mussels. Probably 30 or more?  The bangers and mash were some of the best bangers. The meat in the middle is so juicy and spiced with mustard seeds and other tasty flavors which simply made my day.  If you're a large group try calling ahead and booking the back room during the week. On the weekend though its first come first serve which makes it near impossible if you're more than 4 people trying to walk up at dinner time.  Cheers

8XHshurWGHg_zSZKV4hXYQ.text: Amazing little bar, fantastic service, and amazing food. Fish and chips were delicious. The whiskey samplers are a lot of fun!

-KzkNLDywBpRr1nmeKPsrg.text: Great place to eat. You should definetly spend one night in this bar. The only thing I did not like about this place is the sweet taste that peppercorn sauce has...

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Awesome place !

-2qG66udJLGYNwkERmF8bA.text: Oh man, that whiskey list...  Killer place right across from our hotel room. It was packed and I could totally see why. Their whiskey list was two full Excel spreadsheets with every type of whiskey you've ever known and then some. The service was nice, too. If you're looking for a hard-to-find scotch, they probably have it.

mE8qF1Qgg8A-0oONjTDluQ.text: We stopped in here since it was the closest, open, bar to our hostel on our first night visiting Edinburgh. The decor was very nice, and the people-watching was even better. The crowd skewed mostly older but there were several incredibly attractive and well dressed women in their 30's here when we stopped in.  There was a folk guitar band playing, which was a little too mellow for our tastes. The selection of whiskeys though was phenomenal, and the bartenders were very skilled. The whiskey sour and hot toddy were particularly good! It's a very upscale and classy place.  The bathrooms were clean, and had a goofy condom dispenser that sold "Whiskey Flavored Condoms". We got a good laugh out of that, especially the fine print "Do not Use While Driving".  Good place to stop for a meal and a warm-up drink before heading out for the clubs.

t2ZTV9NxkGQT1hF3mtAlYw.text: Good food and atmosphere. Generous portions and delicious drinks on tap.  Would return.

2Ex6cVUBDd5mQD3wQ403bw.text: Dipped in here on day two in Edinburgh. It was a late morning start and we wanted breakfast. I'd noted another spot that would have been a good mile walk down the way but the driving rain and cozy exterior beckoned us in. One side of the restaurant is a whiskey shop. Impressive array of different types of whiskies - I had no idea or interest as I am not well-refined in the whiskey world. If you are DEFINITELY stop in or shop here. whiskishop.com. We both went with specials. I had the starter and main combo of raw Scottish salmon with a frisee salad and creme fraiche, followed by crayfish linguine. Yum! The salmon was fab, especially when dragged through the creme, followed with a bite of fresh-baked crusty bread. The pasta was lovely as well. Flavorful and cooked al dente with oil, peas and the star - crayfish. Yum. Most UK restaurants have some sort of starter/main special and I highly recommend going this route when possible as you will get a nice variety for your dosh. Man had the Gambon ham and egg special with chips. Gorgeous plating. Egg cooked to perfection so the yolk slowly spilled out over the ham. Chips - awwww! Why can't we get chips this good at home. Thick-sliced but not soggy or under/over done. Crisp and hot. Made with love. So delectable that ketchup is superfluous. Nice price point and very pretty interior. Comfy banquette seating - try to get next to the window to people-watch. Staff were sweet and made sure our coffees and waters were filled. If it hadn't of been morning with a full itinerary ahead, I definitely would have sampled some whiskey. Last note. One of the other Yelpers mentioned the cutesy spelling - it almost threw us off as well but the downpour helped settle our minds quickly.

5sMCxCIOB0TpOxrNUwpc8w.text: We stopped in here because of rain and tired feet. It's a nice pub complete with TVs to watch the Olympics and enjoy some dinner. The burger with haggis, onions, tomato relish, and bacon was great. We had never tried haggis before. I imagined I wasn't going to like it because American food tv shows made it sound so awful!! It was delicious and really made the burger pop. I wasn't in love with the actual burger patty, but all the toppings were so good it made up for the patty being too tightly packed. The fish and chips were also very tasty. We didn't drink anything, but it appeared to have a large selection of local beer and whiskey drinks to enjoy.

8Fhe6fI5_d2QQVL_tfrcVw.text: Visiting Edinburgh our concierge recommended Whiski for a modern take on Scottish cuisine.   It didn't disappoint - maybe the best haggis I've tried!  Their salmon dish was also superb.  A great ambiance and extensive scotch tasting menu rounds off an excellent dining experience.  My Cao Ila distillers edition went very well with the meal.  Will be back!

Z18gTOKTDN-DtTWPSwUxRQ.text: We stopped in for dinner & drinks at the Whiski on a Friday night based on recommendation from our hotel concierge.  Very glad we did.  The place was quite busy, and is obviously popular with locals as well as us tourists.  After notifying one of the employees we'd like to wait for a table, we sidled up to the bar for a round of drinks.  There were a couple of parties waiting ahead of us, and a couple more parties waiting behind us.  To the credit of the waitress, she kept all our groups in sequence and seated each group promptly as a table opened up.  Food was very good pub food, much better than the standard greasy Brit pub food.  Our group had the salmon, a burger, and a couple orders of steak & ale pie...not to mention a few more drinks.  All the food was great, and the portions very generous.  I'm a pretty good eater, and was unable to finish my own meal.  We ended up staying past our meal to see the live band who started playing about 10pm.  They were a local group of Scots playing American bluegrass music.  I'm not a particular fan of bluegrass, but this band was still pretty enjoyable.  Throughout our experience at the Whiski, have to give special compliments to our waitress Chloe, she was awesome!  Took very good care of us, friendly, and made us feel at home.

7scErc27OpSuldcQQDw7WA.text: Quite possibly the best pub we ate at while in Edinburgh for holiday.  I had their sausage and mash of the day which was a Mediterranean pork sausage. It was excellent.  Their selection of Malt Whiskys was as good as advertised.  The service was spot on. This was definitely not what I expected from a very touristy location on the Royal Mile.

R43JLEkgP8tu_KniARhfNg.text: I went to the Whiski Bar craving some good salmon and was not disappointed.  Despite not having reservations we were able to get a table for 2 after a short wait.  The salmon was fantastic.  I also enjoyed one of their many preset whisky flights.  Service was good and everyone was friendly.  I was still obsessing over the salmon the next day when a friend made it to town so I took him there and had it yet again! Plus a different whisky flight because, well, it's Scotland!

bWnbnUvt2ke87OmcizvDhA.text: Came here for dinner on a Thursday night around 7pm and the place was pretty busy already. I was nervous that that I would have to wait for a while, but it was only about ten minutes! I was seated at a table near the door, which I didn't mind because a cool breeze would come in whenever someone opens the door and it was kind of stuffy inside!  It took a little wait before the waitress came around to take my order, but from my experience, it was within expected window of time in Edinburgh.  FOOD/DRINK- of course I had to try the haggis tower! But I ordered the vegetarian version since I had fried haggis the night before. Wow! I was so pleasantly surprised that it was delicious (since its veggie)! It looks like a dessert and was quite filling. I was only able to eat about half. The cookies on it were a bit hard though. The non-alcoholic bottled drink (passion fruit/pear?) I had was refreshing. Wished I came with a friend of two, then I could've tried more food!  AMBIENCE/SERVICE- cozy, well decorated with signs and with a wall shelf full of booze. Tables are small, but cozy in a good way. Noise level was average. Waitress was very nice and friendly. Food came out quickly and hot. And I felt very welcomed and appreciated.   Overall, I had a pleasant experience here and really liked the food. I would recommend this spot for drinks and food for solo travelers, couple for dates, AND groups!

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Entrance
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. I had the Sharpen Up
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beer list

vh4AIZWfiCL8noxtRwfSOQ.text: Amazing haggis. Made me a believer!  Try the Balvenie 14 yr Caribbean Cask, it's amazing.  Bangers and mash had the creamiest mash. Wait was long, but the bar area welcomes you and will transfer your tab. Great experience.

UfkKRdE8bNQ63kHhw6MpGA.text: Loved the whiskey flights. Nice choice of whiskeys. The vegetarian haggis is surprisingly good. The salmon appetizer is great too. Loved the ambience and all the decorations on the wall.  Doesn't disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Scottish theme continues in the men&#39;s room.
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Nice flight selection with information about each whiskey.

K2MYV0ER1udZzQKtm4UOKA.text: Terrific bar and restaurant in old town on the Royal Mile. Despite the name this is not just a tourist trap. Great Scottish food and lengthy whiskey menu makes this a great stop. I had the very traditional Cullen Skink and Haggis Tower, both were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis Tower, don&#39;t be shy
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Warm atmosphere
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scotch whiskey flight. I had the staff recommended.

c3J-1-7I6sR2mWTFqykC9g.text: When my husband and I come to Edinburgh we head straight to the WHISKI Bar & Restaurant. We Love this place! Great food and whiskey!

BEdd5UwyHWrbRIDWQIQaug.text: This place was pretty good. The haggis stack was great and they have all the scotch you could want

9WcieUpc9lY8VH5J_All2w.text: The meal was absolutely fantastic. Very nice presentation. The fish and chips was huge! The home made tartar sauce was delish. I had the salmon, the house made lemon cream sauce made the dish! I love the freshness of the food and the veggies.  The sticky toffy pudding with ice cream was also fab. Atmosphere is very pleasant very relaxing. The only reason I gave four stars was because the service was a little lacking and this one could b considered petty but the please wait to be seated sign was in the middle of the restaurant so was a little confused when I walked in the front door, felt like I was the center of attention. Also they charge for refills lol.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

WZZFb_y4srgjk7SOTIiqdQ.text: Good bar food - great selection of scotch!  Very helpful in selecting my whisky flight.

G-G1AxDbllOqnafMLKpgHw.text: Went for lunch, and the only regret I had was that I didn't go for a bigger meal for dinner!   I got a glass of hot toddy and a starter of spicy prawns with bread. Both were absolutely mouth-watering. I'm very glad I tried my first hot toddy here, and my meal was also delightful albeit only a starter portion. I left feeling happy full.   I absolutely adored the ambience as well. Typical Scottish bar type of place but more sophisticated. I liked their selection of music in the background. They have live music every night at 10pm, so try it out if you can!  Great place on Royal Mile, definitely give it a try!

KpmCFViaQN5E7pv1mPFoBQ.text: We went in mostly because of the atmosphere: at 20:30 on a bank holiday Monday, The Mitre and The Royal Mile Tavern were empty and dead. Whiski, however, had one table left and live music still playing. Definitely the best pub on that strip of the Mile near North Bridge against the other options.  Great whisky, the little writeup that came with the flight was very informative, and it wasn't too overpriced for the tasting. Food was a little lacking though, my steak and ale pie had about 4 cubes of beef in it, and the pie was a tiny puff pastry on top that didn't really match. The fish and chips were very good from what I tried, however.   Good pub, good craic.

NOzwMuLSIBt3e1nM2C2kIQ.text: Any place on the Royal Mile is touristy but food at Whiski bar is tasty.  Had the Seabass and Haggis Tower, both were good as was the service, ambiance is warm, casual and welcoming.   Great place for dinner and/or drinks.   Extensive whisky tasting menu, we did not partake but looked interesting.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis tower

cB7IdpbnA535_4nBuioi3Q.text: We enjoyed our evening here. Food was good. Service was friendly and the walk from adagio hotel was pleasant. We would go back again for the view and the Haggis.

3z6nI7_WgdwumI84d87New.text: Haggis (check): had to try haggis before I left town. well, its alright. Good food (check): we had steak and scottish salmon and they were amazing! steak was perfectly aged and well cooked.....and the salmon, exactly what fresh scottish salmon are hyped up to be! Place was slightly packed for monday evening (3 day weekend)....but thats what you expect at a good place. Waiters were overwhelmed by the crowd, but managed to serve everyone with a smile and patience through that. Live scottish folk music was the cherry on the top.

eu0ry7BtnIFCi8Yb1_gI0w.text: If you are looking for a place with an extensive whisky menu then look no further. The bartenders are very knowledgeable (Tamara was awesome) about the different kinds of whisky so if you are not sure which one you want, just ask and they will recommend one. The food is also excellent like the steak sandwich. In the three days we were in Edinburgh we were there four times. Looking forward to going back again.

On8B_KG7a2WHmYwLf2ekBA.text: We were just walking by around lunch time and had been looking to try cullen skink.  We noticed it on there menu so we decided to go in.  We were greeted and seated promptly.  Our server, Lucie was very friendly.  The cullen skink was delicious! (best we had on our trip).  We also had fish and chips which was some of the best we had as well.  We also bellied up to the bar a few days later for an evening drink.  The bartender was also very friendly.

igi72Caf9HtbWRla1w7U1w.text: Had a pint and the steak and ale pie. Tasty. Convivial atmosphere. Good service. Would happily return.

MbhggpN4fOy-ooiZKD6PSw.text: What a great pub! We enjoyed our dinner and dram so much last night, we made a point to come by this afternoon for a snack and some coffee.   Our server last night, Morgan, was a little shy about her wealth of knowledge at first, but once we got her going she had all kinds of great advice about her favorite whiskies & flights and how to drink them to get the best experience. Our food was great too- typical fish & chips and a haggis dish that both had excellent flavor and came out piping hot. Today we both enjoyed coffee with whisky and shared some decadent sticky toffee pudding. And by "shared" I mean that we fought over every last bite.  We stayed a little longer for the music- a fun little quartet that sat down at a table and played some great traditional songs after a few pints. It looks like they have live music of some sort almost every night of the week! This place has a great atmosphere and awesome welcoming vibes by the staff. Highly recommended.

wgvSPqHCKYWyK3cvUmCbRw.text: Ordered the Steak and Ale Pie that was exceptional. Also ordered the Chicken with wild mushroom sauce. Chicken was moist and delicious. Very well portioned. Very friendly and polite staff as well. Our waitress name was Brynie and she was the best server we've had while in Europe.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak and Ale Pie

-O374iwpKwOCuzHW0NCOVg.text: We stopped in twice during our visit to Edinburgh for drinks and to listen to Scottish music. Very friendly place, great music and the whisky flights (samplers) offered a fun way to learn more about Scotland's national drink.

dqidgDAkTQ43c4kWql9yGA.text: Great service.  Good/great fish n chips and steak n ale pie.  And it was a busy day but still cheery and happy.

kTN6yIMSsXzwXlDpFtYnUw.text: We were drawn to the Whiski because they have live music, which didn't disappoint, even though we sat in the back. However, their food and upscale yet cozy atmosphere made it outstanding. I tried the chicken breast with wild mushroom sauce, which was made with tarragon. Really tasty! My husband had the sausage and mash, and devoured every drop. We finished with the sticky toffee pudding, which seems to be an Edinburgh classic. One bite, and you'll see why.

Dbsk7rfPiQIKdw_FfEIXYw.text: inconsistent service, consistently mediocre food   My friend and I wanted to try some Scottish food after a long day of sight-seeing and chose WHISKI after hearing that they had live music. Unfortunately, they didn't have live music the day we went, which was a tad disappointing but admittedly, our fault.   We found the service extremely inconsistent; on entering the busy establishment, a cold waitress told us that she wasn't sure how long we would have to wait or if we would even be seated before closing time! We waited by the bar and talked to a more sympathetic bartender regarding her whisky recommendations, and she estimated a 30-40 minute wait. After a few minutes, another friendlier server talked to us and seated us immediately, to our confusion.   The best thing I can say about the food was that it was filling. We ordered the haggis tower as our main and the fish cakes and cullen skink as starters. The haggis tower and fish cakes weren't terrible, but the cullen skink tasted like an extremely dilute clam chowder almost to the point of salty water. In terms of ambience, WHISKI has a typical pub atmosphere, with wooden interiors, dim lighting, and loud chattering.   I would suggest checking WHISKI's live music schedule if that interests you, but otherwise, I probably wouldn't recommend WHISKI.

D6NBzmUcqADRmSSFHyDWnw.text: Good location right on the royal mile. Great service food was good not excellent. The ambiance was cool, Great setting with life music. The staff did a great job.

Elr-74TwZ-LY-F0WCiiRnA.text: 3 1/2 stars.  Visited Edinburgh in December 2015 and went to check out this restaurant on the Royal Mile. Ordered the haggis, and thought that it was just a-okay. I'm not sure if it's supposed to be served this way, but I tasted more mashed potatoes than actual offals. The whiskey cocktail that I had ordered was pretty nice, though. Overall, could've been a better experience.

jl4UmNTRDxxBUqNqgrEKRA.text: Extra cold Guinness on tap; great menu offerings and a good vibe. I'll be back. Sea bass, salmon, haggis and garlic cheese bread satisfied our part of 3. Excellent

DzGzLEHkHyoHWeKTtlZ_7A.text: First vegetarian haggis for me. I need to say I'm not a huge fan of it but it was a good dish. The haggis is really special and a little bit to heavy for me. However, the whisky sauce and mash potatoes were both amazing. My bf took the real haggis and he enjoyed it a lot !  Really appreciated the service, nice staff, very welcoming! Thanks for the discovery :)

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetarian haggis

Rdq7AOOOxscUDaUHiOCowA.text: Super fantastic place! Both the food and cocktails are firing on all cylinders! It was our first official meal in Edinburgh and it was the best introduction! The food is great quality and rich with flavor. It was our first intro to haggis and we had them in spring roll form and it was fantastic. Wow! I had no idea I would like it so much. Great flavors! The saltiness of the haggis paired perfectly with the sweet plum sauce. The Cullen Skink was a hearty and smoky haddock soup. Mmmm. Definitely grab this traditional dish! The steak and ale pie was great looking and my friend enjoyed it thoroughly. The whisky drinks were top notch! I could have had the Monkey Kilt all night. I can't wait to bring this recipe back stateside. We liked this place so much for dinner we came back here the same night for a night cap. The place is also warm and inviting and warms the soul on a chilly day. So happy we found this place.

eNTXt8vRfG8aOv9g0SswPA.text: My family and I came in for a meal during our visit to Edinburgh. The lamb, veggies and sauce were so flavorful. We especially liked the leeks. Don't forget dessert, the toffee pudding was delicious!

9MH3_yyy8VzyjlDg2rCbHg.text: What a great Scottish experience.  The waiter was knowledgeable and very attentive.  His knowledge of single malts was superb.  I had the the Haggis tower that was the speciality and wonderful.  Haggis is very tasty!!  The desserts were also wonderful.  Loved the pub atmosphere but the food was much better than typical pub food.  A great experience for all

8ZyObOEhRHOyJuc0zeTEwA.text: My go-to place for really good food and live music that stirs but doesn't assault the senses!  I had a veggie tower that was flavorful and interesting from top to bottom at every bite! The gal behind the bar knew her whiskies and they have several tasting 'flights' or wine or soft drinks. My companions also raved about their meat dishes. There is history here yet with a  modern kitchen. The space can get tight so come early for a good table. The folks who come after dinner tend to stay. It's a multi-age place from what i've seen, mature youth to knee slapping elders. Prices are reasonable.

sBNJK2V6_n7Q8xflYs-ihw.text: What I Ordered: Haggis Tower Flavor: I honestly wasn't a huge fan of this Haggis, mostly because I disliked the whiskey sauce.  I'm sure I would have liked it better if it was dry. Service: Friendly and attentive. Atmosphere: Nice decor. Price: Pretty pricey for the portion size as it's right in the middle of the Royal Mile. Location: Great location.  As mentioned above, it's about as central a location as you can get if you're in old town Edinburgh

XINJcYgqjwz9QZXWimugFQ.text: Cool looking place, awesome food and great selection of whisky!!  WHISKI was the perfect end to a long day of travel in Scotland. 3 of us all shared "WHISKI' most popular" whiskey flight, we were not disappointed. We also all shared the Haggis stack, sundried tomato and pork sausages and mash and the salmon. Everything was incredible and trying haggis for the first time, the whole thing was a lovely experience!!

MedfM3EN-wmLhYtA2u_ZUg.text: While The Whisky was supposed to be the one place we 'just had' to visit in Edinburgh, I wish we had skipped it.  It was crowded, which I actually enjoy in a pub-style  restaurant.  It was also quite unique in the large variety of Scotch flights available, though I am not a  Scotch drinker, others in my group enjoyed it  The dinner menu was good but lacked anything for the smaller appetite, especially when considering appetizers in advance.  The food was delicious, but here is why I can only give 2 stars (and that is generous!)  As I mentioned, it is an evening, starters to dessert and coffee.  I wanted to enjoy everything to get the full Scottish experience, even if it is pricey.  By the time my delicious burger arrived, I could barely eat more than just a few bites. The burger was 22 and reckoning it might make a great middle of the night snack, I asked for a takeaway container and the waitress seemed appalled and said 'NO!'  She proceeded to look down her nose at me with a bit of contempt and tried to take my plate. I told her I would keep it a bit longer and she rolled her eyes and rushed off.  We sat a bit longer and I could feel the waitress staring at me from behind, just waiting and watching for me to figure a way to take the burger with me. At that point, she said it was against the law for me to take food (which I paid a lot for) away from the restaurant.  I don't like wasting food or money and I especially do NOT like being treated like an idiot.  I did wrap the burger up and left it sitting on the table deliberately.  If I'd had a pen and paper I would have written a note of some sort to her, but alas I did not. If I  could have, the note would have asked her if this is how she would like to see her mother or sister or friend treated in public. Would she appreciate it if someone she held close was utterly and completely humiliated in front of not only family but the entire restaurant.  I work in the service industry, but in commercial aviation.  If this were to happen on my aircraft it would be the last day of that individual's career with my airline.  I would make sure that a proper apology was made to the guest and suggest a different career path  Our bill was close to 600.  That was not even close to what it cost for ruining the rest of my trip to Edinburgh.  Enough said. I will never return to The Whiskey and probably not to Edinburgh, either.  Save your money for a place that sincerely VALUES its guests and treats each with care and respect Delete review

mGHQRmlrVAyj71cUXpaQsA.text: My fiancee and I stopped in here near the end of the night. There was some live music and best of all . . . sticky toffee pudding! We actually just stopped in here for the pudding. It was quite good. The staff was also very friendly. It is a nice spot to hit up if you are in Edinburgh.

ytoSdalqLlhGcPr1wFAPBw.text: I was in Edinburgh for the day - intersecting with several college friends of mine who had flown in from all over the world for our 25-year reunion - before heading for a week of whisky-tasting in Speyside.   The day we all arrived coincided with the fabulous Fringe Festival (a different review for that!), so we all went to Old Town Edinburgh to check out the scene and try some haggis. After striking out at a couple of other locations, we stumbled upon The Whiski - what a nice and friendly restaurant this was - and an official Fringe Festival venue as well.   They seated us outside, where we could watch all that was going on with the festival and enjoy the rare sunshine. First "course" was a round of light beer, consumed in short order by our thirsty group, followed by stronger and darker IPA, which our Australian server ("you've come a long way, mate!") recommended as it "paired" well with our meal orders of haggis and freshly-caught Scottish salmon.   The haggis was a revelation - I tried it with anticipation, others in our group with a little trepidation (after checking Wikipedia, which I don't think helped their cause!). The portions looked small but were dense and filling, and the sheep organ meat embedded in the oatmeal "mash" was divine - flavorful and spicy (must've simmered for hours!). I shamelessly and happily polished off what the others did not want!   Our second course of baked Scottish salmon was more to the groups liking. The salmon was freshly-caught as advertised and baked perfectly, with a nice crisp to the skin. I enjoyed it, but it was a distant second to the haggis in my book.   More rounds of beer followed (I stopped after my customary two drinks), and then we headed off into the heart of the Fringe Festival - hunger satisfied - ready to experience what Edinburgh had to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. I loved the effect of the sunlight coming through the stained glass windows.
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lots of interesting pictures are hung up near the stairwell leading to the restrooms downstairs.

sxX-WVgK-74fOSr1vqZXnA.text: My wife and I stopped in here for dinner one night and had a fantastic evening.  I got the scottish salmon with lemon sauce, which was cooked perfectly and the sauce was delicious (not too lemony/acidic). My wife got the WHISKI burger which came with haggis and whisky sauce! Despite it's somewhat impractical size, she managed to finish most of it and enjoyed it quite a bit.   After dinner we decided to try a whisky tasting. Whiski helpfully provides a selection of whisky tasting flights to choose from on their drinks menu. This was perfect for us, since we did not have any prior experience in this area. In particular, they have a whisky flight for beginners which we shared. They flight came with four whiskys and a helpful information pamphlet describing the smells and tastes the whiskys were supposed to evoke. Trying the different whiskys with my wife was a lot of fun and stimulated some really enjoyable and amusing conversations!   I would recommend Whiski for their food, but I especially would recommend coming here to try out Whisky Flight #1 if you've never tried whiskey and don't know where to start.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The flights come with detailed info about each whisky.
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Try flight 1 if you&#39;re a whisky beginner.
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky flights! There are two pages of this!

f4MwJjqE-5Eo6L-Dp5broA.text: Been sitting here over 15 mins ... waitstaff never even acknowledged we were here. Waitress (if that's what they want to call her) could have easily come over and told us they were no longer serving ... we tried to grab her attention but she passed us right by .... not a place with friendly service

xF6-yJvVbc0u5-nkidR_zw.text: They only take reservations Mon-Thurs. definitely recommend getting there by 6:30pm on weekends because it gets very busy very quickly.   Started with the bread and butter, there were about 6 slices of bread and they were thick. No complaints. For dinner, I had the Scottish salmon which came with mashed potatoes and peas, carrots, snap peas. The lemon fill sauce was delicious and came on the side. I very much enjoyed it. My husband had the steak pie. The sauce was a sweet gravy-DELICIOUS. It came with fries, and vegetables. Overall I would give the food an A.   After dinner we ordered the whisky flight 2 to try different whiskys from around Scotland.

i63M84gSj5plI5JTvNgFSg.text: WHISKI is a fun, if not touristy, bar and restaurant right on the Royal Mile. They have a massive whisky collection, a wide selection of local beers, and really decent food. They also have a large number of whisky flights to choose from if you'd like to sample a variety, complete with tasting notes. Staff are very friendly and knowledgable.   I opted for the Whiski Burger, a rather unwieldy burger topped with haggis and a whisky sauce. It was really good, but pretty unmanageable, and a bit expensive (though that's to be expected as this place is in tourist central). Brandon A. got the salmon, which I tried and was really fantastic.    Nice, casual place to get a solid introduction to whisky, and sample some decent Scottish fare. They also have live music every night!

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiski burger (with haggis, whisky sauce)

M1qQnyJXHDJiOKyarGbXWw.text: Haggis! I have been waiting for a month to experience my very first bite of haggis because I might have taken it a bit too seriously ( just kept searching Yelp...). Finally I ended up at the WHISKI bar & restaurant!   Started the meal with a traditional Scottish soup: Cullen Skink, which was my favourite dish of the day. Super yummy. The must-try Haggis tower came in a very generous portion, that tastes more delicious with oak crackers. And finally the Whiski burger(with haggis on top), I was kind of stuffed full of haggis..so I am sorry, Whiski burger, there was just no room for the chemistry we could have had. Service-wise, the waiter is attentive and very knowledgeable about whisky!   Will I come back? That's for sure. It's a great place to start tasting Edinburgh and be introduced to scottish cuisine!

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

DraplJeihrX1NH4NQkJ7cg.text: Edinburgh is an amazing city full of so many choices that it simply can be overwhelming to decide what to pick when you literally only have an afternoon. After walking all over the place we came upon WHISKI Bar and Restaurant and waited the five minutes until they opened. We were the first ones to enter and be seated so we had our pick of seating.   The bartender was the first to greet us and he explained they weren't serving food for another 15 minutes. That's ok, we could start drinking! We ordered drinks and when it came to order I tried the fish cakes for an appetizer and the fish and chips as the main dish.   The fish cakes were absolutely delicious. They were the best fish cakes I have ever had. The pops of stone ground mustard was magnificent! It was so good I could have been happy eating just that! But the fish and chips were equally good! Well not equally but very close!   The service was good. It was like more people started to work so we seemed to get someone new for every step but each was very friendly. I really enjoyed it!

wt_oDT1ln29uw97mP7k8TA.text: Absolutely a must not miss.  We stopped in mid-afternoon and grabbed olives and the cheese plate to share over ciders and whiskies. And is was the perfect relaxing and tasty paise in a great Edinburgh day!

Yl0YHmghWSgokrdUxjubVQ.text: The food is great - if you get it!  On a visit to Edinburgh with my husband and three teens we visited Whiski. Upon arriving we were told we would have to wait 40 minutes for a table. We were ok with that but could not wait at the bar because of our kids. Ok again, we walked around for a bit and our table was ready at 8:00. After waiting to be seated while the manager argued with a couple who wanted a table, we were seated and had to wait 15 minutes for menus and another 10 to get our order taken.   Our appetizers arrived quickly and the haggis tower was delicious. But this is where it took a turn for the worse.   A waitress (who did not take our order) arrived with 3 out of 5 entrees, one of which did not belong to us. Then she came back and asked what we ordered, and said the three orders had not been placed. Another 30 minutes later and 2 of the 3 orders arrived. It seems someone (waitress? Cook?) did not realize we ordered 2 of the same Venison dishes. At 9:45!!! Two and a half hours after we first stepped foot in the pub, our last entree arrived!  The manager brought it and asked what happened. We told him and he took the last venison off the bill.   We appreciated the gesture, but will not return.

4Xx5IGAMUq-MC4-o4UPEHw.text: Came here for dinner, and ordered Haggis and steak & ale pie. Both were wonderful. So flavourful and tasty. I give 5 to the food. We also got the luxury ice cream. I wouldn't recommend that one. Otherwise, everything else was great. I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis
Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak and ale pie

YZCnBilQKsqmT3Lt2Eq3Pg.text: Located on the bustling and touristy Royal Mile, WHISKI was our choice for a very nice dinner while visiting Edinburgh.  All food is made from scratch on the premises and their menu offers seasonal items as well.  They feature Scottish beef and Scottish fish from Port Seton.  Whiski has 300 scotch malt whiskies too!    I chose the venison rump with Port-Thyme sauce and herb-crushed potatoes, 21.95.  It was nothing short of AMAZING!  Medium-rare as ordered, this ranks in one of the best cuts of meat I have EVER had.  I was tremendously happy.   My dining companions had the Steak & Ale pie, 15.50 and the steak, 19.95.  Both ladies loved their dishes, especially my friend who had the steak, red meat is the thing to get here!  To start, we had the Thistly Cross Cider, 5.50, and it was crisp and refreshing.  My other friend had Edinburgh's own Paolozzi beer, a Munich-style lager, which she enjoyed.  The ambiance is dark and filled with interesting knickknacks.  The ladies' room has McCondoms, which are, of course, whisky-flavoured!  We had a hiccup with service and our reservation was "lost" so those are the reasons Whiski is receiving 4 stars instead of 5.  I would, however, definitely return to more menu items and the live music!  Yelp Challenge 2018:  97/100

Q6gZRZaFZkUMjEuMhNgF4g.text: It's only okay.  I had dinner there.  The cullen skink was not as good as at Pibroch Scottish.  The fish was not as good as I had at other places.  The batter was soggy.  I don't recommend this place as there are better places.

eJ2Mx4wK_4JGy_z-U-Tazw.text: Let me respectfully disagree with recent reviewers that gave Whiski Bar and Restaurant good reviews - the place is simply not very good on every level. Drinks were limited in choice, as were the wine and beer options - could have been more disappointed, but was disappointed just the same. Food was not good at all - ordered a bread plate and a bottle of wine to start and both were bad (didn't come close to finishing either. Then it took about an hour to serve the venison, potatoes, carrots, and peas ordered for an entree. Despite being provided a very sharp knife by our disinterested waitress, I was unable to pierce the protective coating that surrounded the meat I was trying to eat. I finally did saw off a small portion of the venison and was not surprised at all to find that it tasted more like rhino than deer.   Don't hardly EVER trash a place like this - every where we have eaten in Scotland has been amazing. But this place is a True NO GO. Try Devil's Advocate or Makar's Gourmet Mash Bar, heck, even Pizza Hut across the street before you make the mistake of going to this place.

vh5rQSyFbSAyxfsSUV_LpQ.text: Lovely ambience and friendly staff.  My friend had a couple single malt of the Islay whiskey and said they were really good. For me, I like to try the local dishes and had their classic dish of steak and ale pie. Love it.  The better way to end dinner but with live folk music from the 2 guys.  They played beautifully and the place was packed from dinner hours to the late night of music and drinks.

3DexfR5PC3SFD4734RT06w.text: My wife and I stopped in to this fun Royal Mile pub and had a late dinner and listen to music on two consecutive evenings. Although crowded on both nights, we were able to secure a small table new the front door where the live music played. The service here was very friendly, welcoming and attentive. The food here is delicious and filling with many traditional Scottish meal items on the menu. My wife order the cheese board which she enjoyed. I had the steak & ale pie with chips and vegetables which was outstanding. The live music which starts between 9:30-10pm added to the pub atmosphere. The prices are very reasonable for both food and alcoholic drinks. #edinburghpubs #edinburghlivemusic #edinburghrestaurants

Gz7OAXh_cshupfECNOVIaQ.text: Came here right at 10:15 after they stopped serving food-- and we're glad, as a mouse scurried right under our feet! Busy and good folk music on a Friday tho- but drinks only for us!

SvUrkaWYZvR35AbW1UAsnA.text: We ate here on the night the Eiffel Tower burned - I don't think I'll ever forget walking inside and gasping with surprise when I saw the TV over the bar, and then watching in horror alongside everyone else at the bar. Anyway, onto the review. There weren't any tables when we arrived, so we started with a wee dram at the bar. As you would expect from an establishment named Whiski Bar, there was a very extensive whisky menu. They advertise as having 300+ to choose from, but I didn't count them. After quite a while waiting at the bar, we finally got a table. It would be almost an hour after that before our food arrived. I'm dinging their rating quite a bit for such a long wait, and for not being upfront about the delays. The waitress's excuse was that there was a large party further back in the restaurant, but surely a restaurant this large right on the main tourist stretch ought to be better prepared for busy dinner hours. The food itself was good but unmemorable. I think I had haggis neeps and tatties, but perhaps that was a different night at a different place. We skipped dessert, because we were tired of sitting in the same place. Verdict: don't come here unless you have a lot of time to spare. I'm certain that there's better places to eat in Edinburgh.

nplTwH2wFH3b2CTKGFS0_Q.text: came here my first night in Edinburgh & was not disappointed! I had the whiskey burger which was a great mix of something i'm familiar with and something new. The staff was super friendly & very accommodating helping out tourists which is not always the case! I will definitely be back.

T2VSOta2QJAFFc0G4NPwMQ.text: Nice place for dinner and drinks that's close to the tourist attractions in Old Town Edinburgh. Somewhat pricey but the ambiance and decor suits the price. In addition to traditional British and Scottish dishes (haggis was great), WHISKI offers a large selections of whiskies, gins, and cocktails. The place also offers whisky flights and tastings at specific times.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis

oPl-ILdW1GCxvQG5o8Ww4w.text: On our first night in Edinburgh on vacation our hotel concierge recommended the Whiski Bar for dinner......PERFECT!!  There are two restaurants that we know of, and we had great meals at both.  We loved the atmosphere and decorations, very warm and welcoming.  If your looking for traditional meals, this is the place.  Fish and chips are outstanding.  Steaks, perfect! Haggis, yes we tried it and recommend the spring rolls for the first time if your not sure (it really is not that bad).  I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu!  Everything is fresh and delicious and cooked to order.  Wait staff is very friendly and helpful when it comes to recommendations.  And the Whisky.....lots of choices and these guys know their stuff.  Let them guide you and you wont regret it.  I don't normally give out 5 stars, so believe me when I say, "it is that good"!!!! Good value Clean facility Helpful & Friendly staff.

EDig0y9OLE1VKKEN6JDNUQ.text: This was the first bar and restaurant I visited in Scotland. It had great food, great drinks, and great customer service! Not to mention great live music too. This will definitely be a favorite of mine and I think it is worth the visit.

QrAB_wSM9-Nv7CAy78uTNA.text: We ate dinner here and it was lovely. The lamb shoulder and venison were cooked to perfection. My husband and I also enjoyed the fun banter with our waiter. By the end of my meal I wanted to lick the plate.

kx0cHLJ3x_4Y2bOyGbclHQ.text: This was one of my favorite restaurants while traveling in Scotland. We tried the haggis stack, Cullen skink, fish and chips, meat pie, and sticky toffee pudding.   I was a little worried when first trying the haggis, but it was quite tasty. The Cullen skink sounds a little unusual, but was fantastic. We tried the Cullen skink at a few other places and liked theirs the best! Fish and chips and meat pie were good. The sticky toffee pudding was delicious!    Would definitely recommend this place. It does get busy and is sometimes hard to get a table, but it's definitely worth it!

ebzCG3CvGSxXNNmNV-R6qA.text: My sister & I ate here last night.  She said her cocktail was fabulous & I had a pint of a local draft and enjoyed it. Haggis tower was terrific and my sister really enjoyed her salmon with lemon cream sauce.  Service was very attentive. Music on Tuesday night is not traditional Scottish, but he was entertaining.

2uRFDhasbU3NwcrS3e2M7A.text: I'm not normally so hard on the Royal Mile pubs. Yes they are nearly all marketed with some collage of Scottish themes to pull people in, trap them, then take all their money, but ironically they often end up being a lot more welcoming than a lot of the local pubs in Edinburgh.  But I felt WHISKI was verging on the exploitative. Okay so nothing was that bad. The food is alright and they have a good selection of whisky (I agree with Kate about the whisky cider). But the prices were just too much. I resent having to pay almost 10 for a main course of average pub food. Plus whilst the staff weren't rude they didn't seem interested either. Also why is the name in CAPITALS? I feel like I am being SCREAMED at.  Perhaps I will try WHISKI again and have a better experience. Perhaps like a good Scotsman I should just stick to the drink.

7gMvlkGXIut-H0gHzMfTQg.text: This is your bog-standard Edinburgh tourist pub. It's named to attract tourist, it's decorated to attract tourists and it attracts tourists. It's very Scottish and very traditional, it embodies everything that is deemed Scottish. As a Scott, I avoid these places like the plague and I am reminded why when I go in - I'm almost a novelty to tourists when they hear my northern accent. No, this place is definitely not for me, but tourists lap this stuff up. Not very authentic, but a nice enough place if you're visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Bar & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiski

wjntGylUEUOnNvq1fo2dHA.text: Whiski is divine and hosts one of the best Scottish beer selections in the city, the restaurant food is also rather delightful!   The decor is very warm and manages to stay the right side of kitsch, and a plus point for all you visitors with children, it's on the Royal Mile & has high chairs.   Try the mash!   ess

hMwD2LfJXmkOA033k5lLQg.text: I visited Whiski after a recommendation from a friend and I have to say it lived up to my expectations! The staff were so polite and friendly I was slightly taken aback- well, it's not every day someone behind a bar asks how your day was. And yes, I'm pretty sure it wasn't flirting!   The staff were particularly accomodating when my German friend, who was fresh off the plane, was asking for Scottish beer recommendations.   The interior is lovely- very Scottish and traditional but it avoids being dark and dingy. Great place to take a friend and show off Edinburgh's pub culture!

rRnjLyhdxklW4GWGWL0QWA.text: Great food, great whiskey selection, a good time.  Went with a bunch of Scots and even they liked it.  I had the haggis which was divine.

1liixO4s31iMwrT48d6MOg.text: Great selection of whisky including a good sampling from every region of Scotland. The staff seemed pretty knowledgable about them too, so don't hesitate to ask for a recommendation.  The food is great as well, especially compared to some of the awful traps found in and around the Royal Mile. Highly recommend the Haggis Tower and the Fish and Chips. The Steak and Ale pie was OK, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.  Definitely a place worth checking out if you are hungry or want to stop in for some Whisky in old town Edinburgh.

2ojL_cQ1QRu2p98Y3Ps4Eg.text: Got Haggis tower. It is fine dining meets Haggis. It's delish. I also orderered whisky (Scotch, for us Americans) on 2 separate occasions.  Ask them for the whisky guide, it will help you choose from the giant selection of whisky. This place generally seems crowded and full of tourists.

LIed30bJS3TQUnrP5VUHPg.text: The Whiski Bar provides a atmosphere that screams Edinburgh.  I met a lot of locals who were friendly.  When in Edinburgh I frequent this place to talk politics and solve world peace with the more experienced Scottsmen and at night I go back to mingle with the more adventurous Scottsmen/women as this place as really inviting setting as a traditional pub.  My favorite drink on the menu is all the vintage Scotch Whiskey they have followed by the rest of the Scotch Whiskey.  If you got a cold and think it may not be a good idea to go to the Whiski Bar.. WRONG THINK AGAIN perfect place to go as their Whiski Hot Toddy can cure most cold's which I though was folk's tale but tried it first hand with a friend  and it helped us fight off some vicious flu like symptoms.  Their Cullen Sink soup is delicious and the Haddock and chips is good  and I don't even like Haddock Fish.  Usually there is a good lunch special that offers some good eats, also try the Steak Ale Pie and Haggis Tower.   Slaandjivaa  /Cheers

sow1v5wFh99g9mPzDbe27Q.text: Just had our 1st visit here and it didn't disappoint. The service was great, really friendly and attentive. The food, well where do I start, we ordered the Whiski burger and the fish and chips. The fish was so fresh and light, the peas that accompanied the fish reminded me of pick peas in the pod when I was a kid. Now the burger - possibly the best burger I have ever had. Crispy bun, beautiful haggis and the best beef every. Would highly recommend. Great pub atmosphere. They don't take reservations for food but just turn up and be amazed. If you have to wait a the bar for a table, the selection of drinks will not disappoint.

kr929Q0ydsMAD_72QR7QMg.text: Haggis and black pudding stack  fantastic. Good service. Interesting surrounds.

LQh1-jruPXrn2YQiOiCusQ.text: Great selection of Scotch, naturally, as well as beers and cocktails.   Didn't try the food, but the music was great.  My boyfriend and I danced along and somewhere a couple of girls have video of us!  Great place.

bMEoceZItHz3l015Nhd8Ag.text: Love this bar/restaurant one of the very few real Scottish ones left in the capital. If you like whisky and good food you will not find better anywhere , has huge variety of Whiskies as well as great fresh homemade food , Steak Pie is legendary in Edinburgh , staff are very good and has good selection of beers/lagers. Scottish band plays about 3 nights a week as well. Families welcome which is rare in Edinburgh.

p9lyvsX-D3vx6psqa6qHSg.text: First bar/restaurant we ever visited in Edinburgh and the only one we keep going back to. Food on both occassions I've eaten there has been a bit small in portion but very tasty.   However, the best thing has to be the service. First time we went we wanted to try some proper Scottish whisky so we asked the bar man for advice. It was quite a busy evening yet he spent about 30 minutes with us describing each one, brought us a couple of samples (which we paid for) but never asked us to buy any bottles or anything.   Probably the best customer service I have ever received in this country for anything and worth going for that alone.

uWJyIrtTKRsxRfLM_Nck1g.text: Whiski (previously Clever Dick's) is situated on the Royal Mile. The food is good but the drinks aren't cheap. The atmosphere is friendly and welcoming to families. They do a great hot chocolate! It's the perfect place to go during the day when it's cold and wet outside. Hours can pass very quickly. However, at night it can get very busy and cramped.

7ygEy5eaJJL81kxs2J5AOQ.text: I love going here for a drink - the atmosphere is warm and inviting and the staff are friendly. Just don't have the food and you'll be right. I had dinner here at two occasions (vegetarian and fish dishes) and on both occassions it was awful. But for a drink it's great! They have a good selection of wines too!

92ZqKIBN309xaEEfLCPT-A.text: What a great bar.  They have a truly impressive selection of whiskey from cheap and common to the kind that I clearly can't afford.  Great live music.  Helpful and polite bar staff.  And a fun atmosphere.  I'll definitely be back.

QXSUoVj1TOqz6q866GQMgQ.text: This is a fantastic pub, great food, a huge selection of whisky, and even if you dont drink whisky ( I dont) there's plenty to interest you.its a great place to go for a night out, they do regular live music nights, and you can take the kids in for lunch during the day. Top Class.

KmXyG8eUU0iKCSq1bn_w7A.text: This is the only bar that I would go into in the Royal Mile as it has a really inviting ambiance with lots of candles and does really excellent food for a bar. The service can be a bit slow but the staff always emphasis that the food is homemade and fresh and that is why it can take a bit longer to serve when it is busy. Hard to get a seat sometimes.

xABRDltgUWMXrxOUnT0Gog.text: No doubts here. Whiski is the place to go to get educated on scotch whisky. (And, please know that you should stop simply refer to it as "whisky"...not "scotch"...you are in Scotland after all. So, it's implied!) Oh! The food is brilliant! Apps to mains. Can't go wrong. Staff is always super friendly and accomodating. Even to Yankees.  Get a flight, or try a monthly special. Have a bite. Great taps too. Don't miss!

6ZpsWmDQfqOIkrIl9mofOA.text: We have been there twice during our stay in Edinburgh. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable to help you to choose your "perfect" Whisky. They have a huge selection of Whiskies available. The prices are very reasonable and they even offer some tasting menues that provide a great selection varying on your experience and taste.   I can surely recommend this place if you want to try some great Whisky. We haven't eaten there, but the menu looked appealing as well.

WIEaIMJ3F3Y5XAF3vCM9Qg.text: Great place to get a lively feel of Edinburgh without the tourist traps (although there were a lot of tourist in there). Space is tight. Food is good. And they have several awesome whiski flights! Great place to get a feel for Scottish pub food followed by some whiski sampling.

jWMogdIO6lEcg5z2oui9Fw.text: I had a little look through other reviews and think I may be the only one so far who was not really massively impressed by this place.   It was a lovely Saturday afternoon and after a childish wee stroll through camera obscura I took my friend here for lunch. He is very much a soup and a sandwich type of bloke so the fact this was on the menu here was a bonus. We arrived and were told that there were no tables, even though I could quite clearly see one, and that they were unsure how long the wait would be. A couple of moments later this was corrected, and we were promptly seated.  The menu here did not blow me away to be honest, pretty much as I expected, soup, sandwiches, the usual scottish fayre really. I had a salmon, lemon and creme fraiche sandwich and he ordered the sweet potato soup with a chicken mayo sandwich. There really was quite a wait for drinks, and for food. The system here seems very disorganised and they did not seem on the ball at all.  The food arrived and it looked good at a brief glance. On further inspection, great big crusty bread for the sandwich, good move. Little to pretty much no filling, very disappointing. The soup, which I wish I had ordered, was very good. Then he bites into his sandwich to find that it is salmon too, not what he had ordered. But we had waited so long, and he is a boy, he will eat anything, so he did. Needless to say, I don't think he was too impressed.  We then asked for the bill, went to pay, etc. We were not asked once if everything was alright or if we enjoyed our food, which to me is just common courtesy. Overall, I had high hopes which sadly were not met. Maybe another time.

WnweRWok-Vg5RAuvVk1ALw.text: I had intended to avoid WHISKI because the cutesy spelling of the name and it's location on the Royal Mile made me think this was a tourist trap of self-important trendiness. It reminded me of all of the "ultra-lounges" at the corporate-run Las Vegas resorts.   However, when I decided that I wanted try haggis, a few folks suggested WHISKI as a good place to go.   WHISKI is nice and classy, but not to the point that I felt underdressed. The menu is definitely aimed at tourists and serves mostly what one would think of as "traditional Scottish fare" (not to be confused with "typical Scottish fare" which usually seems to include Tikka Masala). I ordered the haggis tower (with neeps and tatties) and found it to be excellent. My wife had fish and chips and said they were great.   The whiskey selection was unsurprisingly broad. The prices were a little higher than you would get elsewhere, but you expect that in a nicer tourist place right on High St.

x25bqzBObn3wcmk-Z8ctRw.text: I didn't expect to like this as much as I did - I think I was put off by the poor spelling!   I went with a friend and we had a prime table in the window, out of the way of the big tables of Christmas-dinner groups.   I can't give an extensive food review, as we started with olives and bread and then both had mussels with chips - but everything was just the best possible quality and tasted amazing. Huge pots filled with tender mussels in a rich creamy sauce, a pile of crispy-thin French fries - yum.   The staff were everything you could ask for, too - friendly, helpful, and funny. I'll be going back, as soon as possible!

shO2Jp-f4cniYEX7nVuoDg.text: I honestly wanted to give this place a better rating, but there was nothing great about it. We were seated pretty quickly, but then it all went downhill. There was only server for the whole area and it was pretty hectic, so we were ignored for a while. Once we ordered it took almost an hour to get our food, which was crazy. We had the same drinks we got at the bar for about a half hour before anyone asked us if we would like something else. And at the end of it all the dinners were just ok, nothing special. Its clearly a popular place, but i wouldn't recommend it necessarily because there are so many options on the same street where you might be seated and fed much quicker.

u8OgzJMyCOyR05pZ6W-SAQ.text: Went for dinner. Expensive even for The Royal Mile.  Staff seemed more preoccupied running interference at front door than giving decent service.  Eventually we dragged someone over and ordered an appetizer, then paid and got out.

iyrAX_qDsDixH_AOURERDA.text: On High street in Edinburgh.  Yes that is the tourist main drag.  Decorated in old pub style and elaborate.  Beer is a little more expensive because you are on the main drag.  Have nice Celtic music every evening so great place to chill with no cover charge.  Did not try the food.

4Ci84sOisfTnfI2sCracaA.text: Another stunning find in the Whisky Pilgrimage series.  Some may call this a tourist trap. It is position in the centre of the touristy area, however, this place delivers a lot of whisky in a decent setting.  Why do people need to complain? You get over 270 bottles of beautiful whisky and you don't need to get on a ferry and fight off Highland cows to get a bloody dram.   Decent selection and some exceptional rare bottlings, make this worth a visit.

TzsWJq32uYlDGUorw6CJTA.text: This wasn't chosen by me as it was a social event for a course I'm taking. They handled the large group well, although we had pre-ordered the food so it wasn't too difficult, apart from the people who forgot what they ordered (there's always one).  Really nice place, of course great position above the Mound. Cosy wooden interior and then good view outside. Great for warming up after being outside in the cold. However the food wasn't great - our venison was rather chewy and some people barely touched it. The soup starter was fine but no butter came with the bread.  The price was to be expected for the location, although the beer was very expensive and one might have expected a little more from the food for that price.

V0lDzM9ahU0_3In1CDEXhA.text: A must visit if you're a fan of whiskey! You really feel like you're getting a genuine Scottish experience with it's decor and ambience that feels like it could be 200 years ago. Good quality food with lots of Scottish options available. Great location if you're in the city centre. Worth booking in advance as can get busy.

3ujkxjIbbZhsy38Meu5VVw.text: They were actually having problems in the kitchen when we went, so there was an extremely limited menu. However, we were all able to find things we enjoyed, and the food was great! But what was even better were the drinks and service. We ordered two taste flights of whiskey - the beginner flight and the regional flight. None of us are big fans of whiskey, but it was fun to try each of them and to read the descriptions that came with the flights! Additionally, our server was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. She provided wonderful service and answered all of our questions about the food & drinks! The location on the Royal Mile was great, and we enjoyed the general atmosphere. I would have loved to try the food on their full menu, but we still left feeling full & happy!

w7nPvnSihwxD330Pv8hZaw.text: We went whisky for the famous fish&chips, the food there is good and the service is wonderful.

PFARdggyXVuGFdHL-RLKrQ.text: Every summer, when my boyfriend and I are visiting the north, we always pop over the border, and if the weather is good, we'll drop by Whiski. We like to sit out the front, sipping a cider (or a whisky, of course!), and treat ourselves to a haggis tower and some people watching.   Lovely service, tasty food, ideal location, but the haggis tower portion size could be knocked up a notch!

i_5wPNXESGG6dvoYt_0oRg.text: I got into Edinburgh at 5pm on a Monday night.  I checked into where I was staying and walked around High Street for a bit.  I realized I was starving since I hadn't eaten since breakfast and could use a good meal.  I will not deny that the name Whiski helped me choose to stop here.  The staff was friendly and I was impressed by their extensive menu of whisky.  I opted for a whisky cider which is cider distilled in a whisky cask to give it flavor.  It was my favorite cider that I've had in the UK.  Since I was starving I ordered some food too.  I don't remember the name of the dish but it was beef in an ale gravy with veggies and chips.  Since I figured this was just a pub that catered to tourists I was surprised at the quality of the food, it was really good.  I had another whisky cider and was on my way.  It ended up being the best meal I had during my short trip to Scotland.  Should I find myself back in Edinburgh I would very much like to come back here.

wt52v5fvz-tByhwoRKIlHg.text: This location of the Whiski Bar and Restaurant is just as touristy as its Royal Mile location makes it, but to me it felt cramped and unwelcoming. The place always seems to be packed with happy customers who keep bumping into one another at the seating area and at the bar, and I don't see how everyone rates it so highly. I was disappointed in this location and feel that its sister location just up the street and around the corner is far more classy, welcoming, relaxing, and fun.

Uke2DX93J9j9ugSkgZkOOQ.text: I was in here with my big brother last night, and found it a surprisingly large bit better than my previous experiences would suggest. The Royal Mile on a Saturday night during August can get a bit too much, littered with broken bottles and rowdy (but usually good natured) drunkards. Whiski managed to provide a safe haven from all this, and whilst still mobbed was almost relaxing.  The manager cleared a table up the back so we could have a seat, they sold Wasabi Peas, and even the Bargain Basement Russel Brand singing in the corner had a couple of acceptable tunes up his sleeve.  Surprisingly enjoyable.

Aom_FIfIrY5vpqovzfjmpw.text: Came in for a drink, and whilst they had a lot of whisky (as the name suggests) it was *very* expensive and rather cramped!

Aoj0hQfat9g8Mptvaz3ATw.text: Blah. Just blah.  When you have all of these other cosy wee boozers to choose from on the Mile, I can't see why anyone would really want to go here. Like Gavin M. said, it is trying to be so Scottish, it's almost anti-Scottish, and I hate all these chain-style modern pubs anyway, especially when they try to market themselves as authentic.  Not for me.
